Case reference: 2013000021.CaseDesc: Bones of a right foot with its sock and shoe were found along a river bank.

Case reference: 2012020040.CaseDesc: Jerry Paquette was last seen on the Louis Bull First Nations Reserve on January 1, 1982.

Case reference: 2014005295.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2007, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Javed Hoosain was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Javed had a dispute with his mother prior to leaving his residence.

Case reference: 2012020087.CaseDesc: James Carlson was last seen between 7:00 p.m. and 8:00 p.m. at a local business in Watrous, SK. On May 5, 2010, Mr. Carlson's 1985 Chevrolet Monte Carlo was found in a rural area south of Rosthern. Police have not located Mr. Carlson.

Hair: Brown, Balding in front , longer in back

Case reference: 2014005701.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2011, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Dezso Junaszka was seen for the last time as he left his residence to go to work in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Denim, Blue, Brown, Large white logo on the back and left breast "UNK"
Shoes: White, Running, Running shoes; possibly "Puma" brand

Case reference: 2014006281.CaseDesc: Originally from the Ivory Coast, Mr. Anvire moved to Ottawa when he was 11 years old and remained in Ottawa until his disappearance in 2009. Mr. Anvire contacted his employer in October 2009 and stated that he was going to Montreal and has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002297.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1983, Dean Martin was seen for the last time at a cottage on Mount Carleton in Carleton-sur-Mer, Quebec. He left the cottage without leaving a note or informing anyone. Dean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019029100.CaseDesc: Robert Allen Wetsch was reported missing by family on May 19, 2019. There have not been any confirmed sightings of him since.

Case reference: 2014001767.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1991, Mario Chouinard was seen for the last time while hunting on the Zec Festubert(controlled harvesting zone) located in the municipality of Clovas in the Abitibi-Témiscamingue region of Quebec. Mario has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004565.CaseDesc: On December 1, 2004, Jack Day left Fort McMurray, Alberta, for an unknown destination. On December 4, 2004, Mr. Day's abandoned vehicle was discovered at Chrystina Lake Provincial Recreational area near Swan Hills, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018063443.CaseDesc: On July 2, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Sergio Rodriguez was seen for the last time by his wife in Toronto, Ontario. When Sergio’s wife had returned home from work, he and all of his belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2016070214.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1975, the remains of a female were discovered in the North Saskatchewan River near the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta. The individual had had extensive dental work and had an ‘X’ shaped scar on her left wrist.

Shoes: White, Blue, RUNNERS, White with blue stripe around upper edge of sole
Sweater: White, Pink, White with horizontal pink stripes
Pants: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, PANTY HOSE

Case reference: 2021025959.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1988, a man fell from the Jacques-Cartier Bridge in Longueuil, Quebec. The man died a few hours later and was never identified. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Hair: Brown, Auburn, Long, Wavy, Dark, fine, long and wavy
Socks: White, Red, White with red and navy blue stripes
Sweater: Cotton, Black, Short sleeved, "3310" brand, size small
Pants: Cotton, Blue, Elastics at waist, "Alpine" brand, size 30-76
Coat: Black, Short with cotton cuffs, "Paradise Express" brand
Scar: Chin, Scar on right side of chin, 1.5 cm

Case reference: 2014001016.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1983, the body of an unidentified man was found floating on the St-Lawrence river between L’ile Bouchard et St-Sulpice in Quebec. The man wore a partial upper denture and was missing three teeth.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2020007648.CaseDesc: James Oshanek was last seen at the end of August 1991 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004517.CaseDesc: Edmee (Eva) Mitchell, 83 years old, went missing on August 20, 2004. Mrs. Mitchell was last seen at her rural residence near Kelly Lake, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014007307.CaseDesc: On the 28th of May, 1987, a small shed was moved and a body of what appeared to be a full term infant was found. It had been wrapped in two towels and placed under the shed. Examination of the body was done by the University Of Saskatchewan Department Of Archaeology. It was determined the body was that of a full or part North American Indian and had been there from one to three years. The sex of the infant could not be determined. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2005001999.CaseDesc: In September 1979, Norman Ritchie, was a passenger in a 16 foot cedar strip boat on Georgian Bay near Cove Island, when it capsized. Five victims were recovered, but Mr. Ritchie has never been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014005223.CaseDesc: On March 4th, 2009, Wesley Foulds , 52, left his Abbotsford residence for an appointment in New Westminster.  Mr. Foulds didn't arrive for his appointment, and didn't show up for work later that day.  Mr. Foulds' vehicle was discovered the next day parked near the Hayward Dam in Mission BC.

Case reference: 2014001592.CaseDesc: Robert Mc Sween was reported missing by a family member on October 14, 1994. He was last seen September 18, 1994. The last contact he had with his family was by phone at the beginning of October 1994. Details of the coming and goings of Mr. Mc Sween are unknown by family members. His vehicle was found abandoned in the yard of a restaurant in Montreal.

Case reference: 2014002866.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1989, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Jason Boulton slipped and fell into the water near 12 Mile Creek at the north east corner of the Generating Station in Port Dalhousie Harbour, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006014899.CaseDesc: Robert Commu was last seen at his residence in South Dumfries Township, Ontario on March 31, 1996. At 7:00 p.m. on this date, a neighbour went to the residence and found the front door open and his compact disc player repeatedly playing the same song. Mr. Commu had been despondent over a failed relationship and an illness in the family. Mr. Commu has not contacted any family members or friends since his disappearance.

Jacket: Leather, Black, White, Red Maple leaf on the back
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , lion with wings

Case reference: 2014004703.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1995, Marie-Josée Boisjoli left her home in Laval, QC, mentioning that she was going to an appointment without giving any further details. The next day, her vehicle and personal belongings were found at the family cottage, located in the Gélinas Lake area in Mont-Tremblant. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020007826.CaseDesc: Gerhart Kiel was reported missing from his residence in Minburn, Alberta. His vehicle, a dark grey 2009 Ford Ranger which has a truck bed cover in the same colour, was also reported missing from his residence. Gerhart has not had any contact with his family since November 23, 2019.

Case reference: 2014004987.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2004, Cassandra Wright was seen for the last time leaving the Homewood Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Cassandra said that she would be back in the morning.

Case reference: 2014004252.CaseDesc: Gordie Dixon was reported missing by family members.  Mr. Dixon may have been seen on the Macleod Trail in Calgary, Alberta a couple of months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2020006631.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1980, Alan Hood was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Alan was despondent.

Case reference: 2005006699.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, an unidentified man believed to be between 50 and 60 years old, was found in the woods off of Humberwood Boulevard, near Highway 427 and Rexdale Blvd., in Toronto. He was found beneath an overturned picnic table that he may have been using for shelter. His post-mortem length was reported to be between 5’0"-5’1" and his weight was 122lbs. Found within the vicinity of his body was a right black leather-type boot, a black sock, a white baseball hat, a green winter jacket, a navy-coloured winter jacket, a black long-sleeved shirt, a black belt and an empty bottle of Listerine mouthwash. It is believed that death occurred within 1-2 days of his discovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, He has multiple teeth missing with only one tooth remaining in his lower jaw
Other: Lighter and bus ticket in pocket
Boots: Leather, Black, Left boot only, size 9

Case reference: 2017018201.CaseDesc: Happy Charles, 42 years old, was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan, the evening of April 3rd, 2017. Happy was in frequent contact with her family in La Ronge, Saskatchewan, and had plans to seek treatment for drug addiction.

Jewelry: Grey, small silver locket with a picture of son
Purse: light in color with long straps
Jacket: Leather, Black, worn under long wool coat
Black, long wool coat worn over leather jacket
Pants: Denim, Blue, wears jeans under sweatpants

Case reference: 2019040207.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2015, Denis Chernov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Before he was reported missing, Denis had not been seen or heard from for four years.

Case reference: 2014004805.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratto was reported missing from his Burnaby residence July 27, 2006. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. Ratto since his disappearance. Mr. Ratto previously resided in Quebec and may have moved back. The Burnaby RCMP would like to speak with anyone who has any information on Mr. Ratto's whereabouts.

Hair: Brown, Short, Small brown & grey goatee
Jacket: Black, White, Windbreaker with white markings and a logo

Case reference: 2005003899.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2001, a Caucasian male was found on a bench in an outhouse on a cross country ski trail in the Laurentian Hills, Deep River. He was well-tanned and had recently got a sunburn on his face. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. He is estimated to have been dead for two to three days. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Glasses: Copper, Koh Sakai, frame model KS9365, reflective lens
Jewelry: Blue, Levi's, Blue faced, built in compass watch
Shoes: Black, Replay, size small running shoes
Jeans: Blue, Pepe, size 30, button fly front

Case reference: 2013000088.CaseDesc: On February 19, 1973, Pierre Gariepy was seen for the last time in the Plateau-Mont-Royal district of Montreal, Quebec. Pierre is manic-depressive and was frequently hospitalized.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2014002370.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1997, at approximately 4:30 pm Kelvin Zdarski and two friends left Dauphin, Manitoba and headed for a cabin near Waterhen, Manitoba. Over the course of the evening there was an argument between the men. Kelvin left the cabin and never returned. The men looked for him on their way back to Dauphin and did not see him. A man matching Kelvin's description was seen walking on the road at 7:30 am on the 17th of June. An extensive search by land, air and water proved negative. Kelvin did not take his wallet, money or any identification to the cabin and had no means of transportation. Mr. Zdarski has not been seen or heard from again.

Scar: Left Calf, 1 inch long, back of calf

Case reference: 2014001090.CaseDesc: On July 22, 1973, the body of a healthy Caucasian adult male believed to be between the ages of 30-49 was discovered in the Pacific Spirit Regional Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had a significant amount of high quality dental work, including several extracted teeth. It is believed he died on or around June 30, 1973 and may have been despondent when he was last seen alive.

Shirt: Cloth, Blue, Mens Store in Toronto brand, button-down
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, Timex, Mens Wrist Watch

Case reference: 2006010099.CaseDesc: David Stevens was last seen June 14, 1979, in a canoe on the Ogoki River, approximately 70 km north of Armstrong. He was believed to be going towards Whitewater Lake. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. Stevens.

Case reference: 2008006298.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1996, Audrey Desjardins dropped her friend/co-worker at her residence in Welland after working a night shift.  Mrs. Desjardins was driving a red four-door 1985 Ford Crown Victoria.  The car was in excellent condition and there was a Canadian flag bumper sticker on the left rear bumper.

Boots: Black, running shoe styled work footwear
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Brown, 2 brown stripes on front going to shoulders, belte

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014004844.CaseDesc: On September 30, 2006, Aaron Derbyshire, was seen for the last time in the early morning hours in downtown Kelowna, British Columbia.  Aaron, a long term resident of Kelowna, had spent the evening out with friends after a day's work as a local surveyor.

Case reference: 2019002992.CaseDesc: On August 25, 2018, Anupama Nadagouda was seen for the last time with her daughter, Anvita Mulemane, in India.

Case reference: 2017073538.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2016, an unidentified man was located at Lake Huron Beach, north of Nine Mile River in Goderich, Ontario. The man previously identified himself as Mitchell Nelson. He travelled extensively by bicycle, and was believed to be from Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001743.CaseDesc: Knut Thielemann was last seen walking near the Athabasca Falls in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2017044551.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2017, at approximately 1:00pm, Mark Trizanto was last seen near Roncesvalles Avenue and the Queensway in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001925.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1976, Maggie Natomagan, 74 years old, was last seen in Pinehouse, Saskatchewan. Mrs. Natomagan was known to walk in the bush near the community, however, searches failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2014005302.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2005, in Toronto, Canada, Zaina Trujillo-Talib was abducted by her father, Chaudhry Talib and her paternal grandmother, Shama Talib.  Chaudhry and Shama immediately took six-year-old Zaina to their family home located in Lahore, Pakistan.  Since this time, Zaina's mother has not been allowed to have any contact with her daughter.

Case reference: 2013000019.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2001, Terry Sagal was last seen leaving his South Regina house at approximately 11:00 am. Prior to leaving he took $50.00 cash and mentioned to his wife that he was going to get gas, pick up scotch and go to the Superstore. Shortly after leaving, Terry's Petro-Points card was used at the Albert South Petro Canada on a $26.00 purchase.

Case reference: 2014001907.CaseDesc: Mary Rose Keadjuk was residing at the Gold Range Hotel in Yellowknife, NWT. When she went missing, her personal belongings were found left behind, including her glasses which she relied upon. Mary Rose may have been pregnant at the time of her disappearance.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 1 tooth treated and 6 teeth absent.

Case reference: 2013000012.CaseDesc: Cameron March was last seen by his mother on May 7, 1975, at approximately 3:15 p.m. He was playing on a swing set in a next door neighbour's yard located on Blind Line in the City of Burlington, Ontario. Cameron followed the adult neighbour into the residence and asked to play with a friend. When told the friend was sleeping, Cameron left the residence, walking towards his house.

Teeth: Braces, Braces on lower left side of teeth.  One top tooth discolored.
Shirt: White, T-shirt with green band around collar. Brown and green monkeys climbing on front.

Case reference: 2014004058.CaseDesc: On January 11, 2001, Yvan Martellino was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Yvan was baptized in the name of Joseph Pierre Raymond Lussier. He studied communication and accounting. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021019518.CaseDesc: On May 16, 2021, Bernard Grempel was reported missing from Surrey, British Columbia. On May 14, 2021, Bernard’s last known activity was when he used his Compass Card to tap onto a bus that travels back through New Westminster, North Delta and stops at the Scottsdale exchange at 120th Street and 72nd Ave in Surrey. He was last seen wearing a blue medical mask.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Picture of Rick from Rick and Morty
Right Arm, We cannot resolve problems with the same…
Abdomen, Left rib - Other things may change but we start...
Left Upper Arm, Star of David

Case reference: 2014001323.CaseDesc: Mary Kreiser was last seen September 16, 1987, at the Petro Canada Gas station in Westlock, Alberta.  She has not been heard from since October of 1987. It is believed that Mrs. Kreiser could be in Vancouver, BC area.

Case reference: 2012020025.CaseDesc: At about 8:15 pm on May 3, 1983, 16 year old Shelley-Anne Bacsu left a friend’s house in the Sunset Trailer Park to walk the 7 km to her home. Her route took her west on Highway 16 through Hinton, then north on Highway 40. Witnesses saw Shelley-Anne walking westbound along the shoulder of Highway 16 carrying her school books; she was not hitch-hiking. Shelley-Anne was last seen in the area of what was then the western edge of town. A dark colored van was seen in the area around the time Shelley-Anne was walking home, some reports were that it was stopped at the side of the road near where she was last seen. An extensive search for the van and/or its occupants was not successful. Several days after Shelley-Anne was last seen, some of her belongings were found near the Athabasca River not far from the outskirts of Hinton.

Case reference: 2014004068.CaseDesc: Alexandra Sawicki disappeared from her home in Mississauga, Ontario, on November 13, 2000. She was driving a burgundy 1998 Dodge Neon with 4 doors. Mrs. Sawicki drove to Niagara Falls, Ontario and parked her car in the parking lot by the falls, where it was found abandoned by the Police later that evening. Mrs. Sawicki may have been upset and distraught. She speaks fluent English, Romanian and Hungarian.

Scar: Eyes, Right side of the right eye

Case reference: 2014005193.CaseDesc: Margaret Schwabe was last seen at her home in East St. Paul, Manitoba. She has not been seen since.

Hair: Grey, Wavy, Short, Hair was dyed dark brown with a red undertone
Teeth: Full upper dentures and a partial dental plate on lower jaw

Case reference: 2016008425.CaseDesc: Colleen Sylvia Smith was last seen at home, on February 9, 2016, by her ex-boyfriend/landlord.

Case reference: 2021011416.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2021, Solange Bergeron was seen for the last time as she was drifting uncontrollably in the St. Lawrence River, near the Laviolette Park, in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance, Solange was despondent.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Straight, Long and straight

Case reference: 2021014303.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2013, at approximately 3:56 p.m., Peter Lipinoga was last seen in the area of Terrapin Point in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Peter was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002912.CaseDesc: On June 29, 1982, Serge Aumont was seen for the last time in the Hochelaga district of Montreal, Quebec. Serge left his mother’s home with a friend to go to a medical clinic. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Foreign Object: Mouth, Upper and lower partial dentures

Case reference: 2014005677.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2011, John Fadden was last seen in the University Endowment Lands, British Columbia.  He also suffered from dementia.

Case reference: 2014001747.CaseDesc: On July 1, 1978, Brenda Bidner was seen for the last time in the Saint-Laurent District in Montreal, Quebec. She was known to travel frequently between Montreal and New York, in the United States. Brenda has not been seen and her family has not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2006021599.CaseDesc: Zbigniew Gajda left Thunder Bay on his snowmobile to go ice fishing on Lake Superior.  He was last seen on January 4, 2001 around Caribou Island Point.  It is thought that his snowmobile may have gone through the ice.

Jacket: Black, Purple and blue on arms

Case reference: 2014005846.CaseDesc: André Boucher was last seen on July 16, 2012 in Montreal. Mr. Boucher was living in a rooming house and left all his belongings behind. Mr. Boucher was also known as "Popeye"

Case reference: 2014006341.CaseDesc: Alma Mae Gillespie has been missing since June 10th, 1996 from her residence in Winnipeg, MB. Prior to her disappearance, she talked of wanting to go away and disappear for a while.  This has been done on numerous occasions before, even for years at a time.  In the past she has resurfaced within either the United States or Canada.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2016061153.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1996, a male was found on the shores of the Detroit River in the 800 block of Front Road North, Amherstburg. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 200 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He is described as balding, however, due to the length of time spent in the water, it is possible that his hair was lost after death giving the appearance of male pattern baldness. He is uncircumcised. His appendix is present. Changes to his heart suggest that he had high blood pressure and may have been treated for this. It is believed that he was in the water for days to weeks prior to his discovery.

Sweater: Black, Dark Blue, Knights of Round Table, polo
Jewelry: Gold, Timex, watch with a gold-plated spandex band on his left wrist
Scar: Forehead, 3.8 cm on the right side

Case reference: 2016061106.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2006, the partial remains of a male were recovered from the Jordan Creek by a local resident who was dismantling a beaver dam on Old Hastings Road, in Centre Hastings, which is located North of Belleville, Ontario. The remains are believed to have been there at least 5 to 10 years and likely many more.

Case reference: 2014004009.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1987, Dale Eldridge was seen for the last time as he went down to a river with some of his friends in Peace River, Alberta. Prior to that, Dale had attended a party.

Shoes: White, North Star, North Star brand running shoes

Case reference: 2016068939.CaseDesc: A few days prior to April 3, 1968, the  remains of an adult male were found in a body of water. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140lbs and his length was measured at 5'5", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was believed to be in the water from a few weeks to a couple of months.

Hair: Grey, White, Hair was present at the temples
Teeth: Gold Visible, Upper and lower incisors had gold caps
Underwear: White boxer shorts with a red flowered pattern

Case reference: 2013000062.CaseDesc: Leonard Pinnock has been missing since March 27, 2011. He is originally from Jamaica. He came to visit his family in Montreal and he never made it to the meeting place. He was last seen in the area of Notre-Dame-de Grâce in Montreal, Quebec. He travels between Toronto, Ontario, Montreal and Jamaica.

Case reference: 2006013399.CaseDesc: Dustin Rhodes has been missing from the area of Timmins, Ontario since July 6, 1991.  He was last seen around 11:00 a.m. on that day near his cottage on Gibson Lake.  His truck was found at that location but Mr. Rhodes has not been seen since.

Pants: Cotton, Grey, Blue, Grey or blue work pants

Case reference: 2014002549.CaseDesc: Wladyslaw Klisko was last seen on September 11, 1983, in Montreal. He left his house in the morning to go to church. He took the bus but was not seen at the church.

Case reference: 2014002175.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1983, Dale Dushinski was seen for the last time. During the time of his disappearance, Dale was canoeing on the Athabasca River. His canoe was later found overturned approximately 10 kms north of Fort McMuray, Alberta.

Scar: A scar from a biopsy, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2007005499.CaseDesc: Lindsey Nicholls was 14 years old when she disappeared in 1993. She left the group home where she was living in the Comox Valley, BC at about 10:30 a.m. after having an argument with her foster mother. She was last seen walking away from the residence to visit some friends in Courtenay. She left all of her belongings and treasures in her room; she did not seem to be planning to run away.

Case reference: 2005069040.CaseDesc: Yaseen is believed to be with his mother, Marina Zlonikova. They may be in the Ukraine.

Case reference: 2018016052.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2008, the RCMP attended the scene of a fire in a rural woodland area 25 kilometers north of Lac La Biche, Alberta, where they discovered the partially burned remains of an adult male.

Case reference: 2013000039.CaseDesc:
Darryl Ferneyhough went missing on the morning of Sunday, May 13, 2001. Darryl was seen at the
night club NRG on Gottingen Street at 1:30 a.m. and later seen at 3:40 a.m. running north on Gottingen Street in the area of the Marquee Club.

Case reference: 2006016399.CaseDesc: Noriharu Amano was last seen on July 24, 2005 at the airport on Airport Road in Sault Ste. Marie. He left in a Cessna C-172 aircraft which had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red. The Cessna was last heard from as it was circling over Goulais Bay.

Case reference: 2022012467.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1988, Paul Moore was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Lewiston, New York. His vehicle was subsequently found abandoned in a parking lot near the American Falls. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Case reference: 2014005453.CaseDesc: On December 9, 2004, Sheila Adamo was seen for the last time when she left the family residence in Ottawa, Ontario. She is known to travel to the East Coast as well as into the United States.

Case reference: 2006017099.CaseDesc: Joan Dorothy Lawrence last resided on North Lancelot Road, Huntsville.

Case reference: 2014003770.CaseDesc: Herbert Gross was to meet his girlfriend for lunch on May 4, 1996. He failed to show up, which was extremely out of character for him. On May 7th, a man described as being Caucasian, in his mid-20s, 5'7 and 140-150 lbs, clean shaven with short, brown hair, was seen moving items from Mr. Gross's suite. This man was wearing a dark shirt, faded jeans and white runners. Police feel Mr. Gross may have been the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2013000130.CaseDesc: Norman Rivet was last seen on May 24, 1983 at home in Ville-Émard, a neighbourhood of Montreal.  He left a suicide note to his family.

Case reference: 2014001178.CaseDesc: The body of this adult male was found floating in the Fraser River near Prince George, British Columbia, on July 10, 1967. He wore upper dentures and it is believed he was in the water seven to ten days.

Pants: Blue, Suit Style, Dress pants with large metal buttons
Shoes: Black, Oxford, Pointed Shoes, size 7 or 8

Case reference: 2014004714.CaseDesc: In May 1975, William Lindsay was seen for the last time as he left his mother’s residence in Field, Ontario. William, also known as Larry, is a drifter, and was known to hitchhike. It is unknown what his direction of travel was.

Case reference: 2014005030.CaseDesc: Wilfrid Langlois has been missing since February 5, 1998. At the time of his disappearance, it is possible that he was in the Chandler area of the Gaspé Peninsula.

Case reference: 2014006349.CaseDesc: Jonathan Riley left his residence on April 26, 2013, indicating he was going to Toronto for a few days. His mode of transportation is unknown as he did not have access to a vehicle.  His family and friends have not heard from him since May 2013.  He is a self-employed computer technician.

Case reference: 2011002199.CaseDesc: Sean Tan went missing from his residence, an apartment building on Huron Street in Toronto, on March 7, 2011. Toronto Police Service investigated but to date he has not been located. Mr. Tan  may be despondent and suicidal.

Case reference: 2006006499.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1972, Clifford Boyle was aboard the S.S. Gleneagle on which he was employed. He was last seen on the deck of the left side of the ship near the back.  It is presumed that Mr. Boyle fell overboard and is presumed drowned in Georgian Bay, Ontario.

Amputation: Right Index Finger, End of finger missing

Case reference: 2014003613.CaseDesc: Larry Mattis was last seen when he was taken to the Edmonton airport by a friend and dropped off for a flight to Toronto.

Case reference: 2014001140.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1973, the skeletal remains of a male were discovered 30 miles south of Kashechewan and 60 miles west of Moosonee - 30 feet from a small creek that flows into James Bay. He is estimated to have been dead for 9-12 months.

Case reference: 2014005278.CaseDesc: On July 14, 2009, Yashpal Mehay left his residence in Surrey BC, and was scheduled to travel to Clinton BC, where he co-owned and operated a Petro Canada Gas Station with family. Yashpal Mehay was last seen at the Costco in Abbotsford BC, at 1450 hours on July 14, 2009, where he purchased tobacco, food and gas. Mr. Mehay failed to arrive at his destination in Clinton BC, and there has been no communication with the family. He was very familiar with this route as he travelled it every other week. The Surrey RCMP has conducted extensive searches along the travelled route with negative results.

Shirt: Green, White, Long sleeve "American Eagle" polo

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2015011664.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1994, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 25-35 was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River near the Old Port of Montreal Clock Tower in Montreal, Quebec.

Sweater: Cotton, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Fruit of the Loom brand, T-shirt with short sleeves, faded, size medium
Scar: Right Hand, 2.4 cm at the base of the thumb

Case reference: 2019049184.CaseDesc: On September 6, 1973, the body of a well nourished man were found on East Hastings in Vancouver, British Columbia. He recently had cranial surgery due to a head injury and had several old scars on his scalp.  He had extensive scar tissue around his lungs, possibly due to smoking (emphysema) or multiple infections such as pneumonia or tuberculosis.
